item.title: Beasley upstages Melo's return to New York
item.description: Kristaps Porzingis was sidelined, Carmelo Anthony was in visitor colors, and Michael Beasley was the best power forward on the floor at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night.

item.title: Weary Thunder return home after eventful reunion trip
item.description: Thunder stars Paul George and Carmelo Anthony got to visit their old locales on the same road trip, with triple overtime in Philadelphia in between.

item.title: Melo thanks Knicks, calls tribute 'bittersweet'
item.description: Carmelo Anthony received a mix of cheers and boos in his first game back at MSG since being traded to OKC and said he hopes Knicks fans will remember him as "somebody who wanted to be here" and "remained positive through all the negative situations."

item.title: LeBron: Level of play doesn't reflect my age
item.description: LeBron James, in his 15th season in the NBA, said what he is achieving on the court has not been done a lot in league history, adding that he wants to "break the mold" and stereotype that older players cannot dominate the game as much as younger players.

item.title: Harden expecting to play through pain in knee
item.description: Rockets guard James Harden said he almost sat out the Rockets' game Saturday with a bruised right knee but decided to play. Despite scoring a game-high 31 points, Harden said he expects to have the pain for an extended period of time.

item.title: Spoelstra passes Riley as Heat's wins leader
item.description: Erik Spoelstra passed Pat Riley to become the Miami Heat's all-time wins leader with 455, after the team beat the Clippers 90-85 on Saturday night.

item.title: Plea deal rules Lakers' KCP from 3 road games
item.description: A 25-day restriction stemming from a plea agreement on a misdemeanor offense will keep Lakers guard Kentavious Caldwell-Pope from playing in three of the team's next four road games.

item.title: Warriors to be 'out there' for Kobe ceremony
item.description: "I'm not going to keep them in the locker room to watch tape of the first half," Warriors coach Steve Kerr said of his team being in attendance for Kobe Bryant's jersey retirement ceremony at halftime of Monday night's game. "Let's go out there."

item.title: Pelton mail: Who gets credit for the NBA 3-point revolution?
item.description: Kevin Pelton answers questions on the 3-point explosion, which Gasol brother was better at his peak, what's plaguing the Pelicans and more.

item.title: Kobe Bryant is finally ready to say goodbye
item.description: The Lakers' legend grew up devouring VHS highlights of Wilt, Magic and West. His jerseys will join theirs on Monday night, as Bryant moves on from his NBA career.

item.title: Spurs close on 13-0 run, ageless Ginobili's game winner
item.description: The Dallas Mavericks were four minutes away from a second win over San Antonio this week. But the Spurs locked down and stole the game late.

item.title: Trust Your Elders: Sixers' young stars kept honest by vets
item.description: The Process has led to a high ceiling for the Philadelphia 76ers, but the veterans are there to raise the floor as well.

item.title: Hayward watches Jazz-Celtics, holds out hope for return this season
item.description: Gordon Hayward left Utah for Boston this offseason, but he suffered a season-threatening leg injury in October's opening-night game for the Celtics.

item.title: After loss to depleted Jazz, Irving says Celtics are being tested
item.description: The Celtics have played uneven basketball over their past five games, but Kyrie Irving isn't here for excuses.

item.title: Lowe's 10 things: Lonzo's smart plays, OKC and good news for the Bulls
item.description: Zach Lowe highlights Charlotte's Dwight Howard problem, Lonzo Ball's development, Marcus Smart's manipulative passing and more.

item.title: Embiid defiant after Westbrook says 'go home'
item.description: Joel Embiid was quick to respond after the Thunder's Russell Westbrook waved him off the court and told him to "go home" following OKC's win Friday night. Embiid told reporters, "This is my home. I ain't going nowhere."
